topic.title: Root Instance
topic.p: Root instance is a direct child in an <Instance/>, whose tag name does not begin with "ref.". There must be exactly one root instance in an <Instance/>

The type of the root instance is the base class of this <Instance/>. To create a class:
namespace helloworld { class MainWindow : presentation::controls::GuiWindow { new*(){} } }
The following <Instance/> is expected:
<Instance name="MainWindowResource"> <Instance ref.Class="helloworld::MainWindow"> <Window/> </Instance> </Instance>
Because <Window/>, which is presentation::controls::GuiWindow* because of the default value of the attribute xmlns of <Instance/>, returns raw pointers from all of its constructors, so the constructor helloworld::MainWindow also returns a raw pointer.

Only inheritable classs can be used as a type of root instances. The type of a root instance is also required to have a constructor without parameters. But GacUI also knows how to create UI objects, so <Window/> is also a valid type of a root instance even it has no default constructor.
